A widely watched poll released on Wednesday showed Rousseff losing to environmentalist Marina Silva in an expected runoff  echoing the results of another poll

column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 27 Grupo Oi SA  the Brazilian telecommunications company grappling with swelling debt  hired investment bank Grupo BTG Pactual late on Tuesday to advise on a plan to win control of a larger rival.

column4: UPDATE 3-Time Warner Cable suffers major outage; New York launches probe
column5: BOSTON/WASHINGTON  Aug 27 Time Warner Cable Inc   the No. 2 U.S. cable operator  suffered a massive network outage on Wednesday due to suspected human error that cut Internet services to some 11 million businesses and residences  prompting a New York state investigation.

column4: Tyson wins U.S. Justice Dept antitrust nod for Hillshire deal
column5: WASHINGTON Tyson Foods Inc   the largest U.S. meat processor  on Wednesday won U.S. antitrust approval for its $8.5 billion purchase of Hillshire Brands Co .

column5: Aug 27 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Wednesday:

column4: Tyson wins U.S. antitrust approval of Hillshire deal: U.S. Justice Department
column5: WASHINGTON Tyson Foods Inc has won U.S. antitrust approval for its purchase of Hillshire Brands Company  the Justice Department said on Wednesday.

column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 27 Tyson Foods Inc has won U.S. antitrust approval for its purchase of Hillshire Brands Company  the Justice Department said on Wednesday.

column4: Insurers pay more tax on executive comp under Obamacare: study
column5: When Washington eliminated corporate tax deductions on health insurance executive compensation above $500 000 under President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law in 2013  it generated more than $72 million in additional tax revenue for the U.S. government  a left-leaning think tank said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Workday raises revenue forecast as software subscriptions jump
column5: Aug 27 Workday Inc reported a better-than-expected 74 percent rise in quarterly revenue due to strong growth in subscriptions for its Web-based human resources and financial management software  and the company raised its full-year revenue forecast.

column4: UPDATE 3-Valeant  Ackman get Oct. 6 trial over Allergan special meeting
column5: WILMINGTON  Del.  Aug 27 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  and activist investor William Ackman won their request for an expedited trial on Wednesday over the timing of a special meeting of Allergan Inc  shareholders  a key to their $50 billion hostile takeover fight.

column4: Delaware judge fast-tracks Valeant  Pershing lawsuit over Allergan special meeting
column5: Aug 27 A Delaware judge granted a request by Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc and Pershing Square Capital Management for expedited proceedings in a special meeting dispute with Allergan Inc.

column4: UPDATE 1-Facing shareholder demands  Allergan calls special meeting for Dec. 18
column5: Aug 26 Allergan Inc said on Tuesday that it has scheduled a special shareholders meeting for Dec. 18  when activist investor Bill Ackman  who supports a hostile bid for the company by Valeant Pharmaceuticals Inc  will attempt to oust most of its board.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Wells Fargo hires two Merrill Lynch brokers in Southern California
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 27 Wells Fargo Advisors  Wells Fargo & Co's securities brokerage  said Wednesday it had hired two financial advisers away from rival Merrill Lynch to work at Wells' Seal Beach office in Southern California.
